abstract: Car companies are grappling with an alternate universe of brand associations in China, where Buicks are status symbols and a Mercedes-Benz is the domain of the retiree.
snippet: Car companies are grappling with an alternate universe of brand associations in China, where Buicks are status symbols and a Mercedes-Benz is the domain of the retiree.
lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Cars in the United States tend to come fully equipped with stereotypes. Ford Crown Victoria: law enforcement professional. Toyota Prius: upscale yuppie environmentalist. Hummer: gas-guzzling egotist.

headline.main: In China, Car Brands Evoke an Unexpected Set of Stereotypes
headline.print_headline: In China, Buick’s for the Chic

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Buick Division of General Motors Corp

byline.original: By Andrew Jacobs and Adam Century
